translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions for Phenomena

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (1)🔽19.4. Upādinnattika🔽Naupādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Naanupādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.🔽Naanupādinnaanupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Naupādinnupādāniyañca naanupādinnaanupādāniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  upādinnattika  na aupādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na anupādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca  na anupādinna anupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na aupādinnupādāniyam ca na anupādinna anupādāniyam ca dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka

original: Naanupādinnupādāniyañca naanupādinnaanupādāniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na anupādinnupādāniyam ca na anupādinna anupādāniyam ca dhammam paṭicca upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an object that is clung to and a category that is a condition for what is clung to, there is an object that is not clung to and a category that is a condition for what is clung to. original: Naupādinnupādāniyañca naanupādinnupādāniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnaanupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na aupādinnupādāniyam ca na anupādinnupādāniyam ca dhammam paṭicca anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-adherent and non-adherent-non-adhering as condition, a non-adherent-non-adhering … (The rest is as above.)

original: Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā ekādasa …pe… āsevane cha …pe… vipāke sattarasa …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā ekādasa pe āsevane cha pe vipāke sattarasa pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: In the section on root cause there are eighteen. In the section on object there are nine. In the section on predominance there are eleven. … In the section on kamma result there are seventeen. … In the section on non-conflict there are eighteen.
